qas.question: Where was copper mostly mined at in the Roman era?
What term does the name copper originate from?
What componds are common in copper?
What is one color common in copper salts?
What is the name of the color pigment on building structures that are made using copper.
Where was copper glowing at in the Roman era?
What compounds are radioactive in copper?
What is the name of the color pigment on water that is made using copper?
What term means that copper is an imaginary substance?
What color is most rare in copper salts?

context: In the Roman era, copper was principally mined on <a0_0><b5_0>Cyprus<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the origin of the name of the metal from aes сyprium (metal of Cyprus), later corrupted to <a1_0><b8_0>сuprum<b8_0/><a1_0/>, from which the words copper (English), cuivre (French), Koper (Dutch) and Kupfer (German) are all derived. Its compounds are commonly encountered as <a2_0><b6_0>copper(II) salts<b6_0/><a2_0/>, which often impart <a3_0><b9_0>blue<a3_0/> or green<b9_0/> colors to minerals such as azurite, malachite and turquoise and have been widely used historically as pigments. Architectural structures built with copper corrode to give <a4_0><b7_0>green verdigris<b7_0/><a4_0/> (or patina). Decorative art prominently features copper, both by itself and in the form of pigments.
